subject: Re: -[EVP-ITC] A new hack?
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi Frank,

to get rid of the annoying clicking sound without having to slaughter
the radio and build up a whole sweep generator circuit around it,
wouldn't it perhaps help to connect a simple low pass filter between the
original VT cable and the VT pin? Simply a capacitor of let's say 1 ï¿½F
between the VT pin and ground, and a resistor of let's say 10 k between
the VT cable and the VT pin? This would perhaps smoothen the tuning
voltage during the scanning process.

Is it possible that you try this quickly? It shouldn't take much time,
and would be of great advantage if it worked...

Stefan

-- 


 
 
> Yeah, I was playing with trying to get rid of the clicking sound, and
> saw the VT pin. I found I could manually tune the radio with a volume
> control, or pot, so I had to make a board for it with a sweep
> generator. Now I wish I would have bought the shortwave version!
> Ahhhhh Box 36! Of course, Olgra(old and grumpy wife) isn't too happy
> at paying for a $25 radio that has just been gutted!
 
>  BTW, external tuning gets rid of the clicking, and the audio is surprisingly clear.
